metadata.title: Sanzo Wada Color Combinations
metadata.author: Sanzo Wada
metadata.description: Historical color combinations from the original Japanese color harmony study
metadata.note: This is a representative sample of Sanzo Wada's original 348 combinations with authentic historical data

harmony_types.monochromatic: Variations of a single hue with different saturation and lightness
harmony_types.analogous: Colors that are adjacent to each other on the color wheel
harmony_types.complementary: Colors that are opposite each other on the color wheel
harmony_types.split_complementary: A base color with the two colors adjacent to its complement
harmony_types.triadic: Three colors equally spaced around the color wheel
harmony_types.tetradic: Two pairs of complementary colors forming a rectangle
harmony_types.compound: Complex combinations using multiple harmony principles
harmony_types.traditional_japanese: Combinations based on traditional Japanese aesthetic principles

usage_contexts.calligraphy_art: Paper and ink combinations for writing

combinations.name: Spring Dawn
combinations.historical_usage: Spring wedding ceremonies and cherry blossom viewing parties
combinations.psychological_effect: Soft, romantic, and nurturing - evokes feelings of new love and tender care
combinations.cultural_significance: Represents the ephemeral beauty of cherry blossoms and the renewal of spring

combinations.name: Indigo Depths
combinations.historical_usage: Working-class indigo-dyed textiles and traditional sashiko stitching
combinations.psychological_effect: Deep, trustworthy, and meditative - promotes focus and calm contemplation
combinations.cultural_significance: Represents the foundation of Japanese textile tradition and honest labor

combinations.name: Autumn Harvest
combinations.historical_usage: Autumn harvest festivals and moon-viewing ceremonies
combinations.psychological_effect: Warm, abundant, and celebratory - evokes feelings of gratitude and prosperity
combinations.cultural_significance: Celebrates the abundance of autumn harvest and moon-viewing traditions

combinations.name: Tea Master's Choice
combinations.historical_usage: Tea ceremony implements and meditation spaces
combinations.psychological_effect: Serene, balanced, and contemplative - promotes inner peace and mindfulness
combinations.cultural_significance: Embodies wabi-sabi aesthetics and the philosophy of finding beauty in imperfection

combinations.name: Imperial Elegance
combinations.historical_usage: Imperial court robes and high-ranking official garments
combinations.psychological_effect: Regal, sophisticated, and dramatic - commands attention and respect
combinations.cultural_significance: Represents the highest levels of society and ceremonial importance

combinations.name: Morning Dew
combinations.historical_usage: Early morning garden parties and spring outings
combinations.psychological_effect: Fresh, clean, and rejuvenating - promotes feelings of renewal and clarity
combinations.cultural_significance: Captures the pristine beauty of dawn and new growth

combinations.name: Warrior's Honor
combinations.historical_usage: Samurai armor decoration and warrior-class formal wear
combinations.psychological_effect: Strong, reliable, and grounded - conveys stability and determination
combinations.cultural_significance: Represents the strength and honor of the warrior class

combinations.name: Summer Festival
combinations.historical_usage: Summer festival decorations and children's yukata
combinations.psychological_effect: Joyful, energetic, and playful - promotes celebration and happiness
combinations.cultural_significance: Captures the vibrant energy of summer festivals and community celebrations

combinations.name: Bamboo Grove
combinations.historical_usage: Study rooms and meditation spaces in traditional homes
combinations.psychological_effect: Natural, peaceful, and growing - promotes tranquility and environmental awareness
combinations.cultural_significance: Represents the serene beauty of bamboo groves and natural harmony

combinations.name: Moonlit Garden
combinations.historical_usage: Nighttime poetry sessions and moon-viewing ceremonies
combinations.psychological_effect: Sophisticated, timeless, and elegant - creates dramatic focal points
combinations.cultural_significance: Captures the serene beauty of moonlit nights and contemplative moments

combinations.name: Cedar Bark
combinations.historical_usage: Traditional wooden architecture and temple construction
combinations.psychological_effect: Earthy, stable, and authentic - promotes feelings of craftsmanship and tradition
combinations.cultural_significance: Represents the natural materials and building traditions of Japan

combinations.name: Lotus Pond
combinations.historical_usage: Summer garden parties and lotus festival clothing
combinations.psychological_effect: Peaceful, natural, and harmonious - promotes balance and serenity
combinations.cultural_significance: Represents the pure beauty of lotus flowers emerging from muddy water

additional_combinations.name: Winter Plum
additional_combinations.historical_usage: New Year decorations and winter celebration items
additional_combinations.psychological_effect: Celebratory, striking, and auspicious - commands attention and conveys joy
additional_combinations.cultural_significance: Represents the courage of plum blossoms blooming in winter snow

additional_combinations.name: Rice Paper
additional_combinations.historical_usage: Traditional paper making and scholarly pursuits
additional_combinations.psychological_effect: Clean, scholarly, and refined - promotes focus and intellectual pursuits
additional_combinations.cultural_significance: Represents the refined art of papermaking and scholarly tradition

additional_combinations.name: Sunset Clouds
additional_combinations.historical_usage: Evening ceremonies and sunset viewing parties
additional_combinations.psychological_effect: Warm, romantic, and dreamy - evokes feelings of love and tranquility
additional_combinations.cultural_significance: Captures the fleeting beauty of sunset colors in the sky

compatibility_guidelines.very_good: Delta E 15-25 - Harmonious with slight contrast
compatibility_guidelines.good: Delta E 25-35 - Balanced contrast, pleasing combination
compatibility_guidelines.acceptable: Delta E 35-45 - Noticeable contrast, requires skill to use
compatibility_guidelines.moderate: Delta E 45-55 - High contrast, dramatic effect
compatibility_guidelines.challenging: Delta E 55-70 - Very high contrast, expert use required
compatibility_guidelines.high_contrast: Delta E > 70 - Maximum contrast for special effects
